definition: to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: The most of crown forms wear by the prehistory jade figures in China are rail crown.
sentences.chinese: 考古所见我国史前玉人的冠式多为纵梁冠。

sentences.english: These people are called 'Robust' by archaeologists because of their heavy-boned physique.
sentences.chinese: 因为他们粗壮的体型而被考古学者称为粗壮型南猿。

sentences.english: This is the website of Archaeology Data Service.
sentences.chinese: 这是考古学数据服务网的网站。

sentences.english: Archaeologists have solved an ancient mystery surrounding the famous Easter Island statues.
sentences.chinese: 考古学家发现著名的复活节岛巨古石像的秘密。

sentences.english: Favorite hobbies include archeology, archery, astrophysics, flamenco dancing, and designing clothes.
sentences.chinese: 考古，射箭，天体物理，弗拉明戈舞和服装设计。

sentences.english: Changsha City has decided to build an archaeological site park based on this mausoleum.
sentences.chinese: 长沙市已决定建设汉长沙国王陵考古遗址公园。

sentences.english: Many specialistic techniques contribute to archaeology .
sentences.chinese: 许多专业技术对考古学作出贡献。

sentences.english: Recent excavations have revealed two main Neolithic cultures lying in stratified sequence.
sentences.chinese: 近年的考古发掘，主要显示两个新石器时代的文化层。

sentences.english: Apart from the flute, archeologists have also discovered graves at the site.
sentences.chinese: 除了古笛，考古人员还在遗址中发现了墓穴。

sentences.english: Gradually the archaeologists made the ancient site give up its secrets.
sentences.chinese: 考古学家们逐渐使古遗址失了神秘密感。

sentences.english: Everything is photographed and documented, because, as Serhal says, "archeology is destruction."
sentences.chinese: 因为正如瑟好所言，“考古是一种破坏。”

sentences.english: "Think of the Bible the way you would a stratified archaeological site, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “圣经的撰写过程便如同分层的考古遗址，”他说。

sentences.english: In six years Taposiris Magna has become one of Egypt's most active archaeology sites.
sentences.chinese: 六年之后，马格纳城已成为埃及最为活跃的考古地区。

sentences.english: An archaeologically valuable ancient tomb was unearthed in the underlying soil of this corn field.
sentences.chinese: 这片玉米地下伏土层中出土了一个有考古价值的古墓。

sentences.english: Four years ago, Waldo directed a pair of archaeology students to the site.
sentences.chinese: 四年前，瓦尔多引导了几个考古学的学生去那个地方。

sentences.english: Also archaeological evidence contradicts the picture in Joshua.
sentences.chinese: 而考古学证据也与《约书亚书》的描述矛盾。

definition: to dig up/to appear in an excavation/unearthed/to come up out of the ground
Erlitou (Xia dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 chao2] archaeological site at Yanshi 偃師|偃师[Yan3 shi1] in Luoyang 洛陽|洛阳[Luo4 yang2], Henan)
bronze implement/refers to ancient bronze artifacts, from c. 2,000 BC
